TopicTitle: Sorry if this is an obvious question, I wasn't sure how to word it in the search

Articles.Content: Hello there! I just bought Kerbal today. My brother and I have literally been up until 5am playing it, making ramshackle, wobbly pieces of rubbish that barely fly. Anyway, my question is: to activate or deactivate an engine, you have to zoom right up to your plane or rocket and press \'deactivate\'. Is there a mod to bind this to a key? Or just some easier way? It\'s quite tricky when you\'re in the thick of things to have to fiddle about zooming in. Thanks for the help.
You don\'t have to zoom in at all; you just need the right angle to actually be able to right-click on the part in question
Often I won\'t be able to see the information panels unless I\'m fairly close, which makes it especially difficult. Is there no workaround yet?
There is no easy way of doing this as far as i know.

You might want to change your designs so you don\'t need to individually turn engines on and off.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

It\'s an upper atmosphere jet, using jet engines to get up in the air, and the toroidal spike when the air was too thin. No point just having the jet engines mindlessly wasting fuel when I was that high up. Or do they not use fuel when there\'s no air throughput? Regardless, I thought it was rather neat to switch those off when jumping continents.
If the engines are added with symettry they will all deactivate together, but you still need to right click on it.
